dt: {bc}relating to, arising from, or influencing feelings or emotions {bc}{sx|emotional||}

et: Middle English {it}affectif,{/it} borrowed from Middle French, borrowed from Late Latin {it}affectīvus,{/it} from Latin {it}affectus,{/it} past participle of {it}afficere{/it} "to produce an effect on, exert an influence on" + {it}-īvus{/it} {et_link|-ive|-ive} {ma}{mat|affect:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: relating to, arising from, or influencing feelings or emotions : emotional

dt: {bc}depression that tends to recur chiefly during the late fall and winter and is associated with shorter hours of daylight

shortdef: depression that tends to recur chiefly during the late fall and winter and is associated with shorter hours of daylight —abbreviation SAD

dt: {bc}any of several psychological disorders (such as major depressive disorder or bipolar disorder) characterized by abnormalities of emotional state

shortdef: any of several psychological disorders (such as major depressive disorder or bipolar disorder) characterized by abnormalities of emotional state —called also affective disorder

dt: {bc}relating to, characterized by, or exhibiting symptoms of both {d_link|schizophrenia|schizophrenia} and a {d_link|mood disorder|mood disorder} (such as major depression or bipolar disorder)

shortdef: relating to, characterized by, or exhibiting symptoms of both schizophrenia and a mood disorder (such as major depression or bipolar disorder)
